title: Ted Cruz
added: Republican operative Chad Sweet, the chair of Cruz' 2016 presidential campaign, denounced Cruz for "assault on our democracy."<ref>{{cite news |title=Ted Cruz’s 2016 presidential campaign chair denounces him for ‘assault on our democracy’ after Capitol riot |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2021/01/10/ted-cruzs-2016-presidential-campaign-chair-denounces-him-for-assault-on-democracy-after-capitol-riot/ |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=Dallas News}}</ref>

title: Ted Cruz
added: Republican operative Chad Sweet, the chair of Cruz' 2016 presidential campaign, denounced Cruz for "assault on our democracy."<ref>{{cite news |title=Ted Cruz’s 2016 presidential campaign chair denounces him for ‘assault on our democracy’ after Capitol riot |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2021/01/10/ted-cruzs-2016-presidential-campaign-chair-denounces-him-for-assault-on-democracy-after-capitol-riot/ |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=Dallas News}}</ref> Several corporations halted donations to Cruz and other Republicans who who voted to overturn the election based on Trump's false claims.<ref>{{cite news |title=Corporate America halts donations to Republicans who voted to overturn the election |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/01/10/business/citigroup-bluecross-commerce-bank-pac-donations/index.html |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=CNN}}</ref>

title: Ted Cruz
added: Republican operative Chad Sweet, the chair of Cruz' 2016 presidential campaign, denounced Cruz for "assault on our democracy."<ref>{{cite news |title=Ted Cruz’s 2016 presidential campaign chair denounces him for ‘assault on our democracy’ after Capitol riot |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2021/01/10/ted-cruzs-2016-presidential-campaign-chair-denounces-him-for-assault-on-democracy-after-capitol-riot/ |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=Dallas News}}</ref> Several corporations halted donations to Cruz and other Republicans who voted to overturn the election based on Trump's false claims.<ref>{{cite news |title=Corporate America halts donations to Republicans who voted to overturn the election |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2021/01/10/business/citigroup-bluecross-commerce-bank-pac-donations/index.html |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Ted Cruz, Josh Hawley, Other GOP Objectors Face Donation Boycott From Major Businesses |url=https://www.newsweek.com/ted-cruz-josh-hawley-other-gop-objectors-face-donation-boycott-major-businesses-1560333 |access-date=11 January 2021 |work=Newsweek}}</ref>

title: Ted Cruz
added: In January 2021, Cruz provoked a widespread political and popular backlash after filing [[2021 United States Electoral College vote count|objections to the certification of Joe Biden's victory]] over Trump in the [[2020 presidential election in the united states|2020 presidential election]]; he was criticized for giving credence to the [[Attempts_to_overturn_the_2020_United_States_presidential_election#Stop_the_Steal|baseless conspiracy theory]] that the election was stolen from Trump. On the day the electoral votes were tallied and Cruz filed his objections, a violent mob of Trump supporters motivated by the belief that the election was stolen [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|stormed the United States Capitol]]. Because Cruz helped popularize and legitimize the conspiracy theory that motivated the mob, figures from across the political spectrum argued that he bore responsibility for the riot and the five deaths it caused.<ref name="theguardian-riot" />

title: Ted Cruz
added: Due to his attempt to fly to Cancún during a crisis, Cruz was dubbed "Flyin' Ted" by some media commentators, a reference to Donald Trump calling Cruz "Lyin' Ted" during the [[2016 Republican Party presidential primaries|2016 Republican primaries]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Klein |first1=Rick |last2=Wiersema |first2=Alisa |title='Flyin’ Ted' fuels Democratic hopes of blue Texas: The Note |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/flyin-ted-fuels-democratic-hopes-blue-texas-note/story?id=75976221 |website=ABC News |access-date=February 20, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Lynch |first1=Suzanne |date=February 19, 2021 |title=Big freeze in Texas turns spotlight on dysfunctional energy policies |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/us/big-freeze-in-texas-turns-spotlight-on-dysfunctional-energy-policies-1.4489743 |website=The Irish Times |access-date=February 20, 2021}}</ref>
